result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley E Ammon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.

STAYED
Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Successfully complete the Drug Court Treatment Program.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Firearm warning given.

Defendant Bradley E Ammon in court with attorney Carolyn H Delery.  Defendant Bradley E Ammon in custody.  Sharon A Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 13, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Bradley E Ammon in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Bradley E Ammon in custody.  Bridget D Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.
